ai.summary: The Derwent Dam Green Route is a 12.9 km moderate hike in the UK that circles Derwent Dam and its reservoir. The route offers water views, woodland paths, and a few gentle climbs that suit hikers with some experience, with a steady pace and varied terrain.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain is mixed: towpaths around the reservoir, gravel and dirt trails through wooded sections, occasional open moorland and short road sections. Elevation changes are generally gentle to moderate, with a few steeper segments near the dam; expect muddy or wet patches after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for quick weather changes common in the UK. Wear sturdy boots and bring waterproof clothing, extra layers, and adequate food and water. Stay on marked paths, keep a safe distance from the dam edge, and watch for other trail users. Carry a map, compass or GPS, and a charged phone; tell someone your planned route and ETA. Be mindful of livestock and habitat sensitive areas and check for any closures.
recommended_gear: Fully charged phone with offline maps
